Topical.compute_embeddings¶

Functions

complete_dataset_ast(file_content)

Get all the children and parents for a given file content, concatenate children together and parents together

complete_dataset_pycg(file)

Call PyCG parser and get dependencies from the raw graph

compute_resources(dataset)

Completed the Dataframe containing Dataset repository info with computed embeddings for each domains of the Hydrid Script-level embedding used by Topical

explore_repository(repo_path)

Returns a list of all python script paths contained in a griven repository

get_ast_embeddings(input_seq)

Returns the embeddings for a list of tokenized dependencies

get_code_embeddings(input_seq)

Returns the embeddings for a list of tokenized code

get_docstring(file_content)

Get all the docstring and function names from a given Script and concatenate them separing both type of data by a special token [SEP]

get_first(s[, depth])

Function to separate the different components of an import name (path materialized by a ‘.’)

get_modules(file_content)

Gets the imports and function names for a given python script content

get_pycg(file_path)

PyCG command line to generate a temporary json file containing the dependency graph for a given file

get_resources(topics, type_embeddings)

Completes a given dataset by computing the desired embeddings on each of the repository

iter_json(data_d, pycg_list[, gen, parent])

Recursive function to populate parent - child edges from PyCG dependencies graph

read_script(script_path)

Returns a script given a path if valid

Detail

This script permits to compute the different embeddings composing Topical hybrid Script Embeddings

Topical.compute_embeddings.complete_dataset_ast(file_content: str) → Tuple[str, str]¶

Get all the children and parents for a given file content, concatenate children together and parents together

Parameters

file_content – Python script content

Returns

Tuple containing a string of all parents and a string of all children for a given script content

Topical.compute_embeddings.complete_dataset_pycg(file: str) → List[str]¶

Call PyCG parser and get dependencies from the raw graph

Parameters

file – Path to the file to parse

Returns

List of tuple (parent, children)

Topical.compute_embeddings.compute_resources(dataset: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Completed the Dataframe containing Dataset repository info with computed embeddings for each domains of the Hydrid Script-level embedding used by Topical

Parameters

dataset – Dataframe containing all the informations and the right columns about the dataset

Returns

Augmented Dataframe containing the each hybrid component for each repository

Topical.compute_embeddings.explore_repository(repo_path: str) → List[str]¶

Returns a list of all python script paths contained in a griven repository

Parameters

repo_path – Path to the repository to explore

Returns

List of Python script paths

Topical.compute_embeddings.get_ast_embeddings(input_seq: List[Dict]) → numpy.array¶

Returns the embeddings for a list of tokenized dependencies

Parameters

input_seq – List of tokenized code using the appropriate tokenizer

Returns

Matrix of embeddings corresponding

Topical.compute_embeddings.get_code_embeddings(input_seq: List[Dict]) → numpy.array¶

Returns the embeddings for a list of tokenized code

Parameters

input_seq – List of tokenized code using the appropriate tokenizer

Returns

Matrix of embeddings corresponding

Topical.compute_embeddings.get_docstring(file_content: str) → Optional[str]¶

Get all the docstring and function names from a given Script and concatenate them separing both type of data by a special token [SEP]

Parameters

file_content – Python script content

Returns

String of concatenated docstrings and function names for the given script content, None if the script didn’t contain any

Topical.compute_embeddings.get_first(s: str, depth=None)¶

Function to separate the different components of an import name (path materialized by a ‘.’)

Parameters

  • s – raw import name

  • depth – number of components of the raw name to extract (from the deepest module to the largest one)

Returns

converted import name

Topical.compute_embeddings.get_modules(file_content: str) → Tuple[List[str], List[str]]¶

Gets the imports and function names for a given python script content

Parameters

file_content – Python script content

Returns

A tuple containing the list of imports and the list of function names

Topical.compute_embeddings.get_pycg(file_path: str) → Optional[Dict]¶

PyCG command line to generate a temporary json file containing the dependency graph for a given file

Parameters

file_path – Path to the file

Returns

Dict containing the dependency graph for a given file

Topical.compute_embeddings.get_resources(topics: List[str], type_embeddings: Union[List[str], str]) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Completes a given dataset by computing the desired embeddings on each of the repository

Parameters

  • topics – List of topics to keep the final dataset

  • type_embeddings – List of type of embeddings to compose the hybrid script-level embeddings (Values: doctring, code, ast, pycg)

Returns

Augmented and topic-restricted dataset

Topical.compute_embeddings.iter_json(data_d: Dict, pycg_list: List[Tuple], gen: int = 0, parent: List = []) → None¶

Recursive function to populate parent - child edges from PyCG dependencies graph

Parameters

  • data_d – children left to parse (fraction of PyCG dependencies graph left to parse)

  • pycg_list – parent-child edges

  • gen – current depth of exploration of the depedencies graph

  • parent – List of parents that have been parsed

Topical.compute_embeddings.read_script(script_path: str) → Optional[str]¶

Returns a script given a path if valid

Parameters

script_path – Path to the script to read

Returns

Script content, None if the given path is not valid
